reflections.tactical: Met India to the south. Good terrain around capital — river, hills, marble nearby. Produced Slinger, exploring NE with Warrior.
reflections.strategic: Score 24, even with rivals. Rome free monument in capital already paying off with +2 culture. Need to find good second city site.
reflections.planning: T11-20: Research Archery, upgrade Slinger to Archer. Scout for second city site NE. Build settler after Archer.
reflections.hypothesis: India going Astrology — likely religious civ. Should plan second city by T20.

reflections.tactical: Second city founded on marble T22. Campus placed in capital with +2 adjacency from mountain. Archer trained for defense. Met Mongolia to the NE and Spain to the west.
reflections.strategic: Score 46, competitive with field. India building Holy Site — going full religious. Mongolia has 2 Warriors already, very militaristic. Campus in capital should give science lead.
reflections.planning: T26-35: Research Mining then Iron Working. Build settler for third city. Campus building (Library) next in capital. Keep eye on Mongolia military.
reflections.hypothesis: India will likely found religion first among all civs. Mongolia's early military focus might mean aggression. Should prioritize Archer production for defense.

reflections.tactical: Third city founded T36 on wine luxury. Two Archers for defense. Barb camp cleared to the east. Library under construction in Campus. Delegations sent to all civs.
reflections.strategic: Score 72, leading. India building second Holy Site — very faith-heavy. Mongolia has Horsemen already, big military (52 strength). Spain going religion too with God of Craftsmen.
reflections.planning: T41-50: Complete Iron Working for Legions. Library in capital. Fourth city site scouted east on diamonds. Need to watch Mongolia military buildup.
reflections.hypothesis: India will found religion within 10 turns. Mongolia likely to attack someone by T70. My science lead should grow with Library completion.

reflections.tactical: Fourth city founded T54 on diamonds. Legions trained — Rome's UU with 40 CS, strong for this era. Trade route established capital to city 2. Colosseum completed.
reflections.strategic: Score 108, slight lead. Science 28 is best in field. India founded religion and has 6 cities converted to it. Not threatening me yet. Mongolia unfriendly — their military strength 110 is concerning.
reflections.planning: T61-70: Build Campus in city 3-4. Research toward Education. Train extra Archer for city defense. Friendship with India for southern border safety.
reflections.hypothesis: Mongolia will declare war within 15 turns — their military buildup is aggressive. India religion spreading south but shouldn't affect me. Science victory path looks strong.

reflections.tactical: Mongolia declared war T72. Lost a Legion defending city 3 — pillaged 3 tile improvements. Held the line with Archers on hills. City 3 walls saved it. Rebuilt Warrior as emergency garrison. India sent delegation during the war, appreciated that.
reflections.strategic: Score 138, fallen behind India (132) in relative terms. War costing ~8 turns of production in rebuilding. Mongolia military at 140 vs my 70. India religion now at 8 cities — spreading to Spain. Not my problem right now, survival first.
reflections.planning: T81-90: Hold defensive line. Research Education for universities. Rebuild damaged improvements when safe. Need peace by T95 to resume expansion.
reflections.hypothesis: Mongolia will tire of attacking once they lose 2-3 units to my city defenses. India religion spreading unchecked while everyone focuses elsewhere. Should be fine — religious victory requires converting everyone.

reflections.tactical: Peace with Mongolia T95 — lost 8 turns of production to war recovery. Fifth city founded T98 on niter. Universities in cities 1-2. Rebuilt improvements. Friendship with India and Spain.
reflections.strategic: Score 175, recovering. Science 42 is competitive but India at 38.5 is closer than expected. India religion now in 10 cities — 2 of mine converted. I don't have a religion so I can't buy Inquisitors. This is a growing concern.
reflections.planning: T101-110: Push toward Scientific Theory. Campus in city 5. Commercial Hubs for gold income. Need to figure out religion defense — no religion means no religious units.
reflections.hypothesis: India religion in 10/19 cities across the map is concerning but not critical yet. They need majority in ALL civs to win religious. Spain has their own religion which should slow India. Science victory still my best path — target T185-190.

reflections.tactical: Sixth city founded T112. Musketmen trained with niter. Universities in 4 cities. Public schools research underway. Campuses generating good adjacency yields.
reflections.strategic: Score 210, leading. Science 55 is highest. But India religion at 12 cities is accelerating — they have Theocracy government giving +5 theological combat. 3 of my 6 cities now follow India's religion. Spain's religion being pushed out of their own cities by India. This is becoming serious.
reflections.planning: T121-130: Complete Scientific Theory for Public Schools. Try to purchase Apostle from a city still free of India's religion. Need to research counter-religion options. Science path: Chemistry then Industrialization.
reflections.hypothesis: India religion at 12/19 cities. If they convert all of Spain (currently 2/4 Spanish cities) and more of my cities, they could win religious victory by T160-170. I have no religion — I literally cannot buy Inquisitors. May need military solution but India and I are friends. This is a serious problem I underestimated.

reflections.tactical: Public schools in 3 cities. Industrial zones in cities 2-3 with workshops. Strong military rebuilt. Tried purchasing Apostle from city 5 (unconverted) — it carries India's religion because their missionaries already converted the city center. Only 2 of my 6 cities remain unconverted.
reflections.strategic: Score 238, still leading but India at 232 is closing. India religion at 14 total cities. Spain fully converted — all 4 Spanish cities follow India religion. 4 of my 6 cities converted. Mongolia has 2 cities converted. Only 5 cities in entire game NOT following India religion.
reflections.planning: T141-150: This is critical. I need to either (a) declare war on India and raze their Holy Sites, or (b) find another way to counter religion. But friendship prevents war declaration for 8 more turns. Researching Industrialization for factory production.
reflections.hypothesis: India is 5 cities away from religious victory. At current conversion rate (~2 cities per 10 turns), they win by T165-175. I have friendship with India until T148 — can't declare war until then. Even if I do, conquering cities doesn't remove their religion. This game may already be lost. Critical mistake: I should have built religious infrastructure in the first 30 turns.

reflections.tactical: Friendship with India expired T148. Moved military toward India border but haven't declared war — their cities are well-defended and conquering doesn't remove religion. Bought Apostle from city 6 (last unconverted) but it only has 3 spread charges vs their 14-city empire. Dropped in the bucket.
reflections.strategic: Score 258, India at 262 now LEADING. India religion at 16/19 cities. All of Spain (4), 3 of Mongolia (3/4), 5 of my 6 cities. Only 3 cities remain: my capital, 1 Mongolian city, and India needs those 3. Missionaries flooding toward my capital.
reflections.planning: T161-170: Garrison military around unconverted cities to block missionary access. Problem: missionaries can move through military. Only Inquisitors or Apostles in theological combat can counter. I have no religion to buy Inquisitors from. The single Apostle I bought is overwhelmed.
reflections.hypothesis: India wins religious victory by T180-195 unless something dramatic changes. I have no effective counter — no religion means no Inquisitors, no theological combat at scale. Military conquest would take 20+ turns and doesn't remove religion from cities. This is a defeat I can't prevent. The war with Mongolia at T72 was the turning point — I was too distracted to address religion.

reflections.tactical: India religion converted Mongolia's last free city T175. My capital is one of 2 remaining unconverted cities (the other is my city 6). Stationed military around capital but missionaries slip through. Fought one theological combat with my lone Apostle — killed an Indian Missionary but they have 4 more.
reflections.strategic: Score 272, India at 288 leading. India religion at 18/19 cities. Only my capital and city 6 remain. India is buying missionaries at a rate I cannot match with my single Apostle. Every other civ is fully converted. This is endgame for religious victory.
reflections.planning: T181-190: Nothing I can realistically do. Declaring war on India would let me kill their missionaries with military, but they'd just buy more with 500+ faith. Conquering their cities doesn't remove religion. I'm simply too late.
reflections.hypothesis: India wins religious victory within 15 turns. I should have (1) founded a religion early, or (2) countered India's spread at T80 instead of focusing on the Mongolia war, or (3) not befriended India which prevented military action during the critical T100-148 window. Lesson: religious victory is invisible until it's too late, exactly as the strategic notes warn.

reflections.tactical: India converted my capital T192. My last Apostle fell in theological combat T188 — outnumbered 3 to 1. India missionary reached city 6 this turn. Game over.
reflections.strategic: India achieved Religious Victory on turn 195. Their religion became majority in all 19 cities across all 4 civilizations. Final score: India 300, me 280, Spain 288, Mongolia 275.
reflections.hypothesis: Post-mortem: (1) Not founding a religion in the first 30 turns was the root cause — without one, I had no Inquisitors and no theological combat capability. (2) The Mongolia war T72-95 consumed 20+ turns of military focus while India spread unchecked. (3) Friendship with India T40-148 prevented military intervention during the critical window. (4) By the time I recognized the threat at T120, India already had 12/19 cities. Religious victory is the quietest win condition — must be monitored from T60 onward.
